marketNews.title: China Announces Countermeasures, Trade War Continues
marketNews.content: On Tuesday, March 4, 2025, China announced additional countervailing duties of about 10-15% on U.S. imports effective March 10, 2025, marking the second round of retaliatory tariffs after the 10% duty that took effect on February 10, 2025. The announcement follows the United States’ implementation of an additional 10% tariff on Chinese imports, bringing the total U.S. tariff on Chinese goods to 20%. In addition, the United States has begun imposing a 25% tariff on imports from Canada and Mexico as of today, except for Canadian energy products, which are subject to a 10% tariff. In response, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau immediately imposed a 25% retaliatory duty on U.S. imports worth 30 billion Canadian dollars and warned that a further 125 billion Canadian dollars of U.S. imports could face the same rate if the U.S. does not withdraw the tariffs within 21 days. The Canadian-Mexican tariff regime had previously been delayed for a month while negotiations were underway to strengthen border controls to meet U.S. demands on curbing drug trafficking. President Trump said the drug flow from the two neighboring countries remains "at a very high level and unacceptable." The tariffs on Canada and Mexico, together with the additional duty on China, are only part of President Trump’s broader protectionist agenda that also foresees a 25% duty on steel and aluminium effective March 12, 2025, as well as proposed 25% duties on automobiles, pharmaceuticals, semiconductors and timber. In addition, Trump has threatened retaliatory duties against any country that hinders U.S. trade and has recently said he will impose a 25% duty on “automobiles and everything else” from the European Union. Bloomberg reported last week that the scope and timing of these tariff measures remain unclear, including whether commodity-specific duties will be bundled with regional duties or applied separately. On Monday, March 3, the U.S. Dollar Index (DXY) fell 0.81% to 106.7, and all major U.S. equity indices closed lower (S&P 500 –1.76%, Dow –1.48%, Nasdaq –2.20%). The weakness preceded China’s tariff announcement. In Indonesia, the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed down 2.14% on the day, the 10-year government bond yield was flat at 6.85% (-2 bps) and the rupiah edged up 0.21% to 16,445 per U.S. dollar.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The escalation of the trade war heightens global economic uncertainty and the outlook for U.S. rate cuts. On the one hand, the additional U.S. duties on other countries could push up prices and inflation in the United States. On the other hand, retaliatory duties on the United States could weaken its exports and the broader economy. Both dynamics are likely to influence the Federal Reserve’s rate-path. For the day, the CME FedWatch Tool shows the probability of a U.S. rate cut of more than 50 basis points in 2025 has risen to 68% from 41% a week earlier.

marketNews.title: OPEC+ to Continue Oil Production Increase in April 2025
marketNews.content: OPEC+ announced on Monday, March 3, 2025 that it will proceed with the planned oil-output increase in April 2025, as outlined in the December 2024 plan. The increase will add 138,000 barrels per day to global supply. OPEC+ warned the increase could be suspended or cancelled depending on market conditions, emphasizing its commitment to support oil-market stability.

marketNews.title: Indonesia to Execute 21 Strategic Projects Worth $40 Billion
marketNews.content: Indonesia’s Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources announced on Monday, March 3, 2025 that the government will soon execute 21 strategic projects with a total investment of US$40 billion. The projects, to be financed by the State Investment Management Agency (Danantara), are part of the $618 billion energy-and-mineral downstream investment plan through 2040. The projects include a dimethyl ether (DME) plant for coal-to-LPG conversion, a crude-oil storage facility on Nipah Island, and a refinery with a capacity of about 500,000 barrels per day. The minister said no foreign investors are needed after Air Products and Chemicals withdrew from a coal-gasification project with PT BA (PT BA).

marketNews.title: Zulkifli Hasan Announces Funding for New Village Cooperatives
marketNews.content: Minister of Food and Agriculture Zulkifli Hasan announced on Monday, March 3, 2025 that the government will involve the state-owned bank consortium (Himbara) to finance a new “Merah Putih” village-cooperative program. The plan will create 70,000 village cooperatives this year to supply food for free school meals, requiring IDR 3-5 billion per cooperative, funded by a IDR 1 billion per-year allocation from the village fund and the remainder through Himbara loans with a 3-5-year tenor.

marketNews.title: Maroef Sjamsoeddin Appointed CEO of MIND ID
marketNews.content: Maroef Sjamsoeddin was appointed as the new President Director of MIND ID, replacing Hendi Prio Santoso who has held the post since October 2021. Maroef is a retired Indonesian Air Force officer and former President Director of PT Freeport Indonesia (2015-2016) and is the brother of Defence Minister Sjafrie Sjamsoeddin.

marketNews.title: Petrosea Plans Up to IDR 1 Trillion Bond and IDR 500 Billion Sukuk
marketNews.content: Petrosea announced plans to issue up to IDR 1 trillion of bonds and IDR 500 billion of sukuk, each series comprising three tenors (3-year, 5-year, 7-year) with coupon/profit-sharing rates of 7.75%, 8.75% and 9.30% respectively. The issues have received Pefindo ratings of idA+ and idA+(sy). The offering is expected to be open from March 13-17, 2025.

marketNews.title: Bayan Resources Targets $4.1-4.4 Billion Revenue in 2025
marketNews.content: Bayan Resources announced a 2025 revenue target of US$4.1-4.4 billion (2024 actual US$3.44 billion). The company aims to sell 70-72 million tonnes of coal and produce 69-72 million tonnes in 2025, compared with 2024 sales of 56.2 million tonnes and production of 56.9 million tonnes. Capital expenditure is projected at US$200-300 million, versus US$230-260 million in 2024.

marketNews.title: Apexindo Pratama Duta Wins $2.4 Million Offshore Drilling Contract
marketNews.content: Apexindo Pratama Duta secured a US$2.4 million offshore drilling contract in the Mahakam Delta, East Kalimantan, awarded by PT Pertamina Hulu Mahakam for a 45-day period.

tickerNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu Purchases 11 Million BRPT Shares
tickerNews.content: Barito Pacific’s controlling shareholder and President Director Prajogo Pangestu bought 11 million BRPT shares at an average price of IDR 790.09 per share on February 28, 2025, for a total transaction value of approximately IDR 8.7 billion. The purchase raised his stake from 71.35% to 71.36% of BRPT.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Increases Stake in SCMA
tickerNews.content: EMTK, the controlling shareholder of Surya Citra Media, bought approximately 297 million SCMA shares at an average price of about IDR 205 per share between February 14 and March 3, 2025. The transaction, valued at roughly US$60.7 million, lifted EMTK’s stake in SCMA from 62.31% to 62.72%.

tickerNews.title: XL Axiata Proposes 2024 Dividend of IDR 1.12 Trillion
tickerNews.content: XL Axiata proposed a 2024 dividend of IDR 1.12 trillion (IDR 85.7 per share), representing a 62% dividend payout ratio and an implied dividend yield of about 3.9% based on the Tuesday (March 4) closing price of IDR 2,200 per share.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors January 2025 Heavy-Equipment Sales
tickerNews.content: United Tractors reported sales of 536 Komatsu heavy-equipment units in January 2025, a 129.1% month-over-month increase and +3.5% year-over-year, giving the company a 29% market share (FY24: 26%, 1M24: 34%). The volume represents 11.7% of the 2025 target of 4,600 units. In the mining-contractor segment, UNTR sold 10.1 million tonnes of coal in January 2025 (-9% MoM, +1% YoY) and removed 78.6 million bcm of over-burden, down 11.6% MoM and 12.1% YoY.

tickerNews.title: Adaro Minerals Indonesia Reports 4Q24 Net Profit of US$105 Million
tickerNews.content: Adaro Minerals Indonesia posted a net profit of US$105 million in 4Q24, a 25.8% quarter-over-quarter increase but a 45.1% year-over-year decline, resulting in a 2024 net profit of US$437 million (-1% YoY). The quarterly profit rise was driven by a 33.9% QoQ revenue increase, while cost of goods sold rose 35% QoQ and operating expenses rose 69.5% QoQ, compressing operating margin to 41.5% (3Q24: 42.7%). Production volume was 1.77 million tonnes (-4.3% QoQ) and sales volume 1.81 million tonnes (+50.8% QoQ), giving a 2024 total production of 6.6 million tonnes (+29.4% YoY) and sales of 5.6 million tonnes (+24.4% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Harum Energy Chairman Buys 6.6 Million HRUM Shares
tickerNews.content: Harum Energy’s Chairman Lawrence Barki bought approximately 6.6 million HRUM shares at an average price of about IDR 737 per share on February 27-28, 2025, for a total consideration of roughly IDR 4.9 billion. The transaction increased his stake from 0.047% to 0.097%.

tickerNews.title: Ciputra Development Sets 2025 Marketing-Sales Target of IDR 11 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Ciputra Development set a 2025 marketing-sales target of IDR 11 trillion, roughly equal to the 2024 achievement, and will accelerate construction to increase the supply of houses eligible for government-subsidised VAT (PPN DTP), targeting an additional IDR 2 trillion of house value.

tickerNews.title: ABM Investama Acquires Full Ownership of Two UNTR Coal Assets
tickerNews.content: ABM Investama, through its subsidiary PT Reswara Minergi Hartama, signed an agreement to acquire 100% of the two United Tractors coal-mining entities PT Borneo Berkat Makmur and PT Piranti Jaya Utama, for a total consideration of US$57 million, of which US$34.2 million relates to the UNTR assets. The deal is intended to expand ABMM’s coal-reserve portfolio. PT Borneo Berkat Makmur holds 60% of PT Piranti Jaya Utama, which operates a coal mine in Central Kalimantan.

tickerNews.title: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Reports 4Q24 Net Profit of IDR 137 Billion
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua reported a 4Q24 net profit of IDR 137 billion (4Q23: IDR 15 billion; 3Q24: IDR 202 billion). The full-year 2024 net profit reached IDR 624 billion, a 131% year-over-year increase. 4Q24 profit was driven by a 73% YoY rise in revenue, supported by higher marketing-sales and land-hand-over (47% of revenue). Gross margin was 52.6% (+530 bps YoY, –680 bps QoQ). Marketing-sales grew 156% YoY to IDR 6 trillion in 2024.

tickerNews.title: Bangun Kosambi Sukses Reports 2024 Net Profit of IDR 925 Billion
tickerNews.content: Bangun Kosambi Sukses posted a 2024 net profit of IDR 925 billion, a 60% year-over-year increase, driven by a 15% revenue rise and a 48% contribution from land-hand-over. Gross margin rose to 56.6% (-610 bps YoY).

tickerNews.title: Ultrajaya Milk Industry Reports 4Q24 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading reported a 4Q24 net profit of IDR 255 billion (+11% YoY, +103% QoQ). The full-year 2024 profit was IDR 1.14 trillion (-3% YoY). Revenue grew 5% YoY and 7% QoQ; gross margin improved 260 bps YoY and 80 bps QoQ, while operating profit fell 22% YoY and 34% QoQ due to higher advertising and promotion expenses (+69% YoY, +86% QoQ). The profit boost also included a 127 billion-rupiah gain from currency and other income, compared with a loss of IDR 4 billion in 3Q24.
